trans-unit.source: Returns a list of meta keys to be (maybe) populated in wp_update_user().
Returns a listing of all files in the specified folder and all subdirectories up to 100 levels deep.
Returns a navigation menu object.
Returns a post array ready to be inserted into the posts table as a post revision.
Returns a pretty, translated version of a post format slug
Returns a shortlink for a post, page, attachment, or site.
Returns a submit button, with provided text and appropriate class
Returns all navigation menu objects.
Returns all revisions of specified post.
Returns all the block categories that will be shown in the block editor.
Returns an HTML-formatted link using get_author_posts_url().
Returns an absolute server path (eg: /home/user/public_html/wp-content/themes/my_theme), not a URI.
Returns an array of WP_Theme objects based on the arguments.
Returns an array of WP_Theme objects based on the arguments.
Returns an array of WordPress tables.
Returns an array of allowed HTML tags and attributes for a given context.
Returns an array of post format slugs to their translated and pretty display versions
Returns an array of single-use query variable names that can be removed from a URL.
Returns an array of the names of all registered dynamic block types.
Returns an array of user roles for a given user object.
Returns an associative array of registered block data keyed by block name. Data includes properties of a block relevant for client registration.
Returns an object containing the ‘id’, ‘domain’, ‘path’, and ‘site_name’ properties of the network being viewed.
Returns array of network plugin files to be included in global scope.
Returns array of stylesheet names of themes allowed on the network.
Returns array of stylesheet names of themes allowed on the site or network.
Returns array of stylesheet names of themes allowed on the site.
Returns array with imported permalinks from WordPress database
Returns arrays of emoji data.
Returns block output from block’s registered render_callback.

Returns contents of an inline script used in appending polyfill scripts for browsers which fail the provided tests. The provided array is a mapping from a condition to verify feature support to its polyfill script handle.
Returns document title for the current page.
Returns drop-ins that WordPress uses.
Returns error instance if value cannot be decoded.
Returns errors property.
Returns false if $base is not absolute, otherwise an IRI.
Returns false if the user cannot manipulate one of the associated settings, or if one of the associated settings does not exist.

Returns false if the user cannot manipulate one of the associated settings, or if one of the associated settings does not exist. Also returns false if the associated section does not exist or if its capability check returns false.
Returns first matched extension from Mime-type, as mapped from wp_get_mime_types()
Returns first matched mime-type from extension, as mapped from wp_get_mime_types()
Returns if an error occurred during most recent JSON encode/decode.
Returns only allowed post data fields
Returns or Prints link to the author’s posts.
Returns or prints a category ID.
Returns preferred mime-type and extension based on provided file’s extension and mime, or current file’s extension and mime.
Returns reference to the parent theme.
Returns stream of current image.

Returns the ‘home’ option with the appropriate protocol. The protocol will be ‘https’ if is_ssl() evaluates to true; otherwise, it will be the same as the ‘home’ option. If $scheme is ‘http’ or ‘https’, is_ssl() is overridden.
Returns the ‘site_url’ option with the appropriate protocol, ‘https’ if is_ssl() and ‘http’ otherwise. If $scheme is ‘http’ or ‘https’, is_ssl() is overridden.
Returns the *nix-style file permissions for a file.
Returns the HTML of the sample permalink slug editor.
Returns the ID of the post’s parent.
Returns the JSON object for the post.
Returns the JSON object for the proxied item.
Returns the Site Icon URL.
Returns the URL of the directory used to store personal data export files.
Returns the URL that allows the user to register on the site.
Returns the URL that allows the user to retrieve the lost password
Returns the URL to the directory of a theme’s “stylesheet” files.
Returns the URL to the directory of a theme’s “template” files.
Returns the URL to the directory of the theme root.
Returns the URLs for CSS files used in an iframe-sandbox’d TinyMCE media view.
Returns the absolute path to the directory of a theme’s “stylesheet” files.
Returns the absolute path to the directory of a theme’s “template” files.
Returns the advanced options for the nav menus page.
Returns the arguments for the help tab on the Edit Site screens.
Returns the canonical URL for a post.
Returns the classes for the comment div as an array.
Returns the columns for the nav menus page.
Returns the content for the help sidebar on the Edit Site screens.
Returns the correct generator type for the requested output format. Allows for a plugin to filter generators on an individual basis using the ‘get_the_generator_$type’ filter.
Returns the current element.
Returns the current version of the block format that the content string is using.
Returns the default TinyMCE settings.
Returns the default annotation for the web hosting altering the “Update PHP” page URL.
Returns the directory used to store personal data export files.
Returns the initialized WP_Http Object
Returns the initialized WP_oEmbed object.
Returns the initialized WP_oEmbed object.
Returns the key of the current element.
Returns the language for a language code.
Returns the list of classes to be used by a meta box.
Returns the loaded MO file.
Returns the main screenshot file for the theme.
Returns the main site ID for the network.
Returns the menu formatted to edit.
Returns the name of a navigation menu.
Returns the navigation to next/previous set of posts, when applicable.
Returns the object subtype for a given object ID of a specific type.
Returns the original input array.
Returns the output array.
Returns the path on the remote filesystem of ABSPATH.
Returns the path on the remote filesystem of WP_CONTENT_DIR.
Returns the path on the remote filesystem of WP_LANG_DIR.
Returns the path on the remote filesystem of WP_PLUGIN_DIR.
Returns the path on the remote filesystem of the Themes Directory.
Returns the post thumbnail caption.
Returns the privacy policy link with formatting, when applicable.
Returns the regexp for common whitespace characters.
Returns the sanitized value for a given setting from the current customized state.
Returns the screen layout options.
Returns the screen’s per-page options.
Returns the space used by the current blog.
Returns the term’s parent’s term_ID.
Returns the theme’s post templates for a given post type.
Returns the theme’s post templates.
Returns the upload quota for the current blog.

Returns the user’s primary blog, if they have one and it is active. If it’s inactive, function returns another active blog of the user. If none are found, the user is added as a Subscriber to the Dashboard Blog and that blog is returned.
Returns true if the block type is dynamic, or false otherwise. A dynamic block is one which defers its rendering to occur on-demand at runtime.
Returns useful keys to use to lookup data from an attachment’s stored metadata.
Returns whether the server is running Apache with the mod_rewrite module loaded.
Returns whether the server supports URL rewriting.
Revokes Super Admin privileges.
Rewind the comments, resets the comment index and comment to first.
Rewind the loop posts.
Rewind the posts and reset post index.
Rewinds the Iterator to the first element.
Rotates current image counter-clockwise by $angle.
Run a loopback test on our site.
Run an upgrade/installation.
Run tests to determine if auto-updates can run.
Run the SQL version checks.
Run the wp query to fetch the posts for listing on the edit posts page
Runs WordPress Upgrade functions.
Runs an insert or replace query based on $type argument.
Runs before the schema is upgraded.
Runs just before PHP shuts down execution.

Runs the action ‘generate_rewrite_rules’ with the parameter that is an reference to the current WP_Rewrite instance to further manipulate the permalink structures and rewrite rules. Runs the ‘rewrite_rules_array’ filter on the full rewrite rule array.
Runs the initialization routine for a given site.
Runs the shutdown handler.
Runs the uninitialization routine for a given site.

SECURITY WARNING: This function is NOT intended to be used in circumstances where the authenticity of the IP address matters. This does NOT guarantee that the returned address is valid or accurate, and it can be easily spoofed.
SQL fragment to append to the main JOIN clause.
SQL fragment to append to the main WHERE clause.
SSL utilities for Requests
Safely extracts not more than the first $count characters from html string.
Same as {@link export}, but writes the result to a file
Sanitises various option values based on the nature of the option.
Sanitize Term all fields.
Sanitize a ‘relation’ operator.
Sanitize a mime type
Sanitize a theme header.
Sanitize a token list string, such as used in HTML rel and class attributes.
Sanitize a value based on a schema.
Sanitize an input.
Sanitize and validate data required for a user sign-up.
Sanitize content with allowed HTML KSES rules.
Sanitize every post field.
Sanitize every user field.
Sanitize meta value.
Sanitize post IDs for posts created for nav menu items to be published.
Sanitize post field based on context.
Sanitize space or carriage return separated URLs that are used to send trackbacks.
Sanitize the current title when retrieving or displaying.
Sanitize the setting’s value for use in JavaScript.
Sanitize user field based on context.
Sanitizes (where possible) the params on the request.
Sanitizes POST values from an input taxonomy metabox.
Sanitizes Term for editing.
Sanitizes a URL for use in a redirect.
Sanitizes a bookmark field.
Sanitizes a filename, replacing whitespace with dashes.
Sanitizes a hex color without a hash. Use sanitize_hex_color() when possible.
Sanitizes a multiline string from user input or from the database.
Sanitizes a string and removed disallowed URL protocols.
Sanitizes a string from user input or from the database.
Sanitizes a string key.
Sanitizes a title with the ‘query’ context.
Sanitizes a title, or returns a fallback title.
Sanitizes a title, replacing whitespace and a few other characters with dashes.
Sanitizes a username, stripping out unsafe characters.
Sanitizes a widget instance.
Sanitizes all bookmark fields
Sanitizes an HTML classname to ensure it only contains valid characters.
Sanitizes and validates the list of post statuses, including whether the user can query private statuses.
Sanitizes and validates the list of theme status.
Sanitizes content for allowed HTML tags for post content.
Sanitizes plugin data, optionally adds markup, optionally translates.
Sanitizes term fields, according to the filter type provided.
Sanitizes the cookies sent to the user already.
Sanitizes the incoming data, to ensure that it matches the type of data expected, using KSES.
Sanitizes the list of subtypes, to ensure only subtypes of the passed type are included.
Sanitizes the slug value.
Sanitizes the widget form values as they are saved.
Save a file submitted from a POST request and create an attachment post for it.
Save a post submitted with XHR
Save starter content changeset.
Save the post for the loaded changeset.
Save the properties of a menu item or create a new one.
Save the properties of a menu or create a new menu with those properties.
Save the value of the setting, using the related API.
Saves a draft or manually autosaves for the purpose of showing a post preview.
Saves and restores user interface settings stored in a cookie.
Saves current image to file.
Saves current in-memory image to file.
Saves image to file.
Saves image to post along with enqueued changes in $_REQUEST[‘history’]
Saves nav menu items
Saves option for number of rows when listing posts, pages, comments, etc.
Saves the XML document into a file
Saves the data to the cache.
Saves the object cache before object is completely destroyed.
Saves the settings for all instances of the widget class.
Saves the value of the setting, using the related API.
Scale an image to fit a particular size (such as ‘thumb’ or ‘medium’).
Scale down an image to fit a particular size and save a new copy of the image.
Scale down the default size of an image.
Scans a directory for files of a certain extension.
Schedules a recurring event.
Schedules an event to run only once.
Screen reader text for nav element. Default 'Comments navigation'.
Screen reader text for nav element. Default 'Post navigation'.
Screen reader text for nav element. Default 'Posts navigation'.
Screen reader text for navigation element. Default 'Posts navigation'.
Screen reader text for the filter links heading. Default 'Filter items list'.
Screen reader text for the items list heading. Default 'Items list'.
Screen reader text for the pagination heading. Default 'Items list navigation'.
Screenshot URL, e.g. <a href="https://wordpress.org/themes/twentynineteen/">https://wordpress.org/themes/twentynineteen/</a>.
Screenshots for a theme must be in the stylesheet directory. (In the case of child themes, parent theme screenshots are not inherited.)
Search Parameters
Search all registered theme directories for complete and valid themes.
Search content for shortcodes and filter shortcodes through their hooks.
Search criteria to match terms. Will be SQL-formatted with wildcards before and after.
Search for disabled element tags. Push element to stack on tag open and pop on tag close.

Search keyword(s). Prepending a term with a hyphen will exclude posts matching that term. Eg, 'pillow -sofa' will return posts containing 'pillow' but not 'sofa'. The character used for exclusion can be modified using the the 'wp_query_search_exclusion_prefix' filter.
Search keyword. Searches for possible string matches on columns. When $search_columns is left empty, it tries to determine which column to search in based on search string.
Search only inside HTML elements for shortcodes and process them.
Search term(s) to retrieve matching comments for.
Search term(s) to retrieve matching networks for.
Search term(s) to retrieve matching sites for.

Searches for metadata in the first 8kiB of a file, such as a plugin or theme. Each piece of metadata must be on its own line. Fields can not span multiple lines, the value will get cut at the end of the first line.
Searches in the stylesheet directory before the template directory so themes which inherit from a parent theme can just override one file.
Searches the object type content for a given search request.
Searches up the list of functions until it reaches the one that would most logically had called this method.
Second of the minute. Accepts numbers 0-60.
Section the control belongs to.
Sections are now rendered in JS by default, see WP_Customize_Section::print_template().
See Methods section below.
See wp_queue_comments_for_comment_meta_lazyload().
See wp_queue_posts_for_term_meta_lazyload().
See ‘after_switch_theme’.
See ‘init’.
See Data Validation for more information on escaping and sanitization.
See sanitize_post() for optional $filter values. Also, the parameter $post, must be given as a variable, since it is passed by reference.
See also
See also get_permalink().
See the ‘customize_dynamic_setting_args’ filter.
Selects a database using the current database connection.
Selects the first update version from the update_core option.
Send Access-Control-Allow-Origin and related headers if the current request is from an allowed origin.
Send XML response back to Ajax request.
Send a DELETE request
Send a GET request
Send a HEAD request
Send a HTTP request to a URI using PHP Streams.
Send a HTTP request to a URI using cURL extension.
Send a JSON response back to an Ajax request, indicating failure.
Send a JSON response back to an Ajax request, indicating success.
Send a JSON response back to an Ajax request.
Send a PATCH request
Send a POST request
Send a PUT request
Send a TRACE request
Send a Trackback.
Send a comment moderation notification to the comment moderator.
Send a confirmation request email to a user when they sign up for a new site. The new site will not become active until the confirmation link is clicked.

Send a confirmation request email to a user when they sign up for a new user account (without signing up for a site at the same time). The user account will not become active until the confirmation link is clicked.
Send a confirmation request email to confirm an action.
Send a confirmation request email when a change of network admin email address is attempted.
Send a confirmation request email when a change of site admin email address is attempted.
Send a confirmation request email when a change of user email address is attempted.
Send a notification of a new comment to the post author.
Send a pingback.
Send a referrer policy header so referrers are not sent externally from administration screens.
Send an HTTP request to a URI.
Send an OPTIONS request
Send an email to the old network admin email address when the network admin email address changes.
Send an email to the old site admin email address when the site admin email address changes.
Send an email to the user with a link to the personal data export file
Send mail, similar to PHP’s mail
Send multiple HTTP requests simultaneously
Send multiple requests simultaneously
Send nocache headers on authenticated requests.
Send required variables to JavaScript land
Sends Cross-Origin Resource Sharing headers with API requests.
Sends a Link header for the REST API.
Sends a pingback error based on the given error code and message.
Sends a request to run cron through HTTP request that doesn’t halt page loading.
Sends additional HTTP headers for caching, content type, etc.
Sends an HTTP header.
Sends an HTTP status code.
Sends an email upon the completion or failure of a background core update.
Sends back current comment total and new page links if they need to be updated.
Sends multiple HTTP headers.
Sends pings to all of the ping site services.
Sends the Recovery Mode email to the site admin email address.
Sends the recovery mode email if the rate limit has not been sent.
Separate HTML elements and comments from the text.
Separates an array of comments into an array keyed by comment_type.
Separator character. Default '—'.
Separator for between the terms. Default '/'.
Serialize data, if needed.
Serves as a callback for handling a menu item when its original object is deleted.
Serves as a factory for Customize Controls and Settings, and instantiates default Customize Controls and Settings.
Serves as a helper function for parsing an XML response body.
Serves as a utility function to determine whether a key exists in the cache.
Serves as a utility method for adding widgets to the registered widgets global.
Serves as an alias of wp_unregister_sidebar_widget().
Serves the XML-RPC request.
Session handler for persistent requests and default parameters
Set $this->charset and $this->collate
Set HTTP status header.
Set PHP error reporting based on WordPress debug settings.
Set URL to link the user to when closing the Customizer.
Set a property’s value
Set array with imported comments from WordPress database
Set blog defaults.
Set cURL parameters before the data is sent
Set categories for a post.
Set custom fields for a term.
Set custom fields for post.
Set default certificate path.
Set internal encoding.
Set item group, unless already in a lower group.
Set query variable.
Set return values.
Set the ‘populated_children’ flag.
Set the Headers for 404, if nothing is found for requested URL.
Set the activation hook for a plugin.
Set the authority. Returns true on success, false on failure (if there are any invalid characters).
Set the autofocused constructs.
Set the cookie domain based on the network domain if one has not been populated.
Set the current screen object
Set the database table prefix and the format specifiers for database table columns.
Set the deactivation hook for a plugin.
Set the default values
Set the entire IRI. Returns true on success, false on failure (if there are any invalid characters).
Set the given item
Set the headers for caching for 10 days with JavaScript content type.
Set the headers to prevent caching for the different browsers.
Set the ifragment.
Set the ihost. Returns true on success, false on failure (if there are any invalid characters).
Set the initial URL to be previewed.
Set the ipath.
Set the iquery.
Set the iuserinfo.
Set the localized direction for MCE plugin.
Set the mbstring internal encoding to a binary safe encoding when func_overload is enabled.
Set the parent information for the screen.
Set the port. Returns true on success, false on failure (if there are any invalid characters).
Set the role of the user.
Set the root value for a setting, especially for multidimensional ones.
Set the scheme. Returns true on success, false on failure (if there are any invalid characters).
Set the site name assigned to the network if one has not been populated.
Set the site to operate on. Defaults to the current site.
Set the terms for a post.
Set the uninstallation hook for a plugin.
Set the value of a query variable.
Set up blog options property.
Set up capability object properties.
Set up constants with default values, unless user overrides.
Set up global post data.
Set up global user vars.
Set up the Loop based on the query variables.
Set up the WordPress Globals.
Set up the WordPress query.
Set up the amount of found posts and the number of pages (if limit clause was used) for the current query.
Set up the current user.
Set up the enqueue for the CSS & JavaScript files.
Set up the enqueue for the CSS files
Set up the enqueue for the JavaScript files.
Set up the hooks for the Custom Background admin page.
Set up the hooks for the Custom Header admin page.
Set up the next post and iterate current post index.
Set up the object properties.
Set up the setting for aggregated multidimensional values.
Set up the user contact methods.
Set/update the value of a site transient.
Set/update the value of a transient.
Sets $header PO header to $value
Sets HTTP method for the request.
Sets Image Compression quality on a 1-100% scale.
Sets a cookie for a user who just logged in. This function is deprecated.
Sets a parameter on the request.
Sets a post’s publish status to ‘publish’.
Sets a single HTTP header.
Sets a single link header.
Sets a translation textdomain.
Sets a value at a specified offset.
Sets all header values.
Sets block type properties.
Sets blog id.
Sets body content.
Sets categories for a post.
Sets current image size.
Sets default parameters.
Sets handle group.
Sets headers on the request.
Sets mod transient.
Sets multipart file parameters from the body.
Sets or returns whether the block editor is loading on the current screen.
Sets or updates current image size.
Sets parameters from the body.

Sets parameters from the route.
Sets post type properties.
Sets taxonomy properties.
Sets the 3-digit HTTP status code.
Sets the 404 property and saves whether query is feed.
Sets the Content-Type header. Sets the ‘error’ status (if passed) and optionally exits. If showing a feed, it will also send Last-Modified, ETag, and 304 status if needed.
Sets the access and modification times of a file.
Sets the attributes for the request.
Sets the categories that the post id belongs to.
Sets the category base for the category permalink.
Sets the comment_status of a given comment object when creating or updating a comment.
Sets the connection’s character set.
Sets the content type header to text/xml.
Sets the cookies used to store an unauthenticated commentator’s identity. Typically used to recall previous comments by this commentator that are still held in moderation.
Sets the data contents into the cache.
Sets the display status of the admin bar.
Sets the endianness of the file.
Sets the features support for the post type.
Sets the handler that was responsible for generating the response.
Sets the header on request.
Sets the input array.
Sets the internal order number for the widget instance.
Sets the list of global cache groups.
Sets the main permalink structure for the site.
Sets the old string-based contextual help for the screen for backward compatibility.
Sets the post thumbnail (featured image) for the given post.
Sets the query string property based off of the query variable property.
Sets the recovery mode cookie.
Sets the response data.
Sets the result of an upgrade.
Sets the route (regex for path) that caused the response.
Sets the route that matched the request.
Sets the scheme for a URL.
Sets the site to operate on. Defaults to the current site.
Sets the status of a comment.
Sets the table prefix for the WordPress tables.
Sets the tag base for the tag permalink.
Sets the template for a post.
Sets the transient.
Sets the translation domain for this dependency.
Sets translated strings for a script.
Sets up Imagick for PDF processing.
Sets up Object Cache Global and assigns it.
Sets up The Loop with query parameters.
Sets up a new Archives widget instance.

Sets up a new Links widget instance.
Sets up a new Meta widget instance.

Sets up a new RSS widget instance.

Sets up a new Recent Posts widget instance.
Sets up a new Search widget instance.

Sets up a new Text widget instance.
Sets up all of the variables required by the WordPress environment.
Sets up most of the KSES filters for input form content.
Sets up object properties, including capabilities.
Sets up object properties; PHP 5 style constructor.
Sets up server and method property. Passes XMLRPC methods through the ‘xmlrpc_methods’ filter to allow plugins to extend or replace XML-RPC methods.
Sets up the WordPress Loop.
Sets up the WordPress query by parsing query string.
Sets up the WordPress query for retrieving comments.
Sets up the WordPress query for retrieving networks.
Sets up the WordPress query for retrieving sites.
Sets up the WordPress query, if parameter is not empty.
Sets up the comment query, based on the query vars passed.
Sets up the current comment.

Sets up the network query, based on the query vars passed.
Sets up the object’s properties.
Sets up the post object for preview based on the post autosave.
Sets up the query for retrieving terms.
Sets up the query variables based on the request. There are also many filters and actions that can be used to further manipulate the result.
Sets up the site query, based on the query vars passed.
Sets up the term query, based on the query vars passed.
Sets up the theme-switching process if a theme other than the active one is being previewed and customized.
Sets up the translated strings and object properties.
Sets up this cookie object.
Sets whether the table layout should be hierarchical or not.
Setter.
Setting any query variable’s value to boolean false removes the key (see remove_query_arg()).
Settings errors should be added inside the $sanitize_callback function defined in register_setting() for a given setting to give feedback about the submission.
Setup dependencies.
Setup the cURL handle for the given data
Setup the new site signup
Setup the new user signup process
Shorten a URL, to be used as link text.
Shorten version of WP_Rewrite::generate_rewrite_rules() that allows for shorter list of parameters. See the method for longer description of what generating rewrite rules does.
Show Comments section.
Show UI for adding new content, currently only used for the dropdown-pages control. Default false.
Show a username form for the favorites page
Show all posts (true) or paginate (false). Default false.
Show content based on post and page parameters. Remember that default post_type is only set to display posts but not pages.
Show posts associated with a certain custom field.
Show posts associated with a certain time and date period.
Show posts associated with certain type.
Show posts associated with certain post status.
Show posts associated with certain author.
Show posts associated with certain categories.
Show posts associated with certain tags.
Show posts associated with certain taxonomy.
Show posts based on a keyword search.
Show posts if user has the appropriate capability
Show posts if user has the appropriate capability.
Show recent drafts of the user on the dashboard.
Show the link to the links popup and the number of links.
Show the number of posts that would show up on page X of a static front page.
Show the random image option if this theme has multiple header images. Random image option is on by default if no header has been set.
Show the widgets and their settings for a sidebar.
Sidebar args.
Signature Verification with SoftFail was added.
Similar to _deprecated_function(), but with different strings. Used to remove PHP4 style constructors.

Simple function whose main purpose is to allow filtering of the list of roles in the $wp_roles object so that plugins can remove inappropriate ones depending on the situation or user making edits. Specifically because without filtering anyone with the edit_users capability can edit others to be administrators, even if they are only editors or authors. This filter allows admins to delegate user management.
SimplePie_Cache
SimplePie_File
SimplePie_Sanitize
Since 4.5.0, taxonomies should be passed via the ‘taxonomy’ argument in the $args array:
Since Version 4.9 Introduced the `$comment_count` parameter. It can be either an Integer or an Array.

Since the shortcode needs to be run earlier than other shortcodes, this function removes all existing shortcodes, registers the shortcode, calls do_shortcode(), and then re-registers the old shortcodes.
Since the term can be an object, integer, or string, make sure that any numbers you pass in are explicitly converted to an integer (example:
Since version 3.4 the TinyMCE body has .rtl CSS class. It is a better option to use that class and add any RTL styles to the main stylesheet.
Singleton that registers and instantiates WP_Widget classes.
Singular form to be localized.
Singular form to be localized. No longer used.
Singular label for an object being listed, e.g. 'post'. Default empty
Site data will be cached and returned after being passed through a filter. If the provided site is empty, the current site global will be used.
Site fields to return. Accepts 'ids' (returns an array of site IDs) or empty (returns an array of complete site objects).

Site status or array of statuses. Accepts 'id', 'domain', 'path', 'network_id', 'last_updated', 'registered', 'domain_length', 'path_length', 'site__in' and 'network__in'. Also accepts false, an empty array, or 'none' to disable ORDER BY clause. Default 'id'.
Size in bytes of the enclosure.
Size in bytes to limit the response to. Default null.
Size of file in bytes.
Size of the images to display. Accepts any valid image size, or an array of width and height values in pixels (in that order). Default 'thumbnail'.
Slashes will first be removed if magic_quotes_gpc is set, see https://secure.php.net/magic_quotes for more details.

So, to expose your new, custom query variable to WP_Query hook into the ‘query_vars‘ filter, add your query variable to the $vars array that is passed by the filter, and remember to return the array as the output of your filter function. See below:
Some $show values are deprecated and will be removed in future versions. These options will trigger the _deprecated_argument() function.

Some functionality requires API to exist, so some PHP version may lose out support. This is not the fault of WordPress (where functionality is downgraded, not actual defects), but of your PHP version.

Some users have issues with opening large files and manipulating the contents for want is usually the first 1kiB or 2kiB. This function stops pulling in the plugin contents when it has all of the required plugin data.
Sort by strlen, longest string first
Sort categories by ID.
Sort categories by name.
Sort menu items by the desired key.
Sort menu objects by the class-supplied orderby property.

Sort retrieved posts by parameter. One or more options may be passed. To use 'meta_value', or 'meta_value_num', 'meta_key=keyname' must be also be defined. To sort by a specific $meta_query clause, use that clause's array key. Accepts 'none', 'name', 'author', 'date', 'title', 'modified', 'menu_order', 'parent', 'ID', 'rand', 'relevance', 'RAND(x)' (where 'x' is an integer seed value), 'comment_count', 'meta_value', 'meta_value_num', 'post__in', 'post_name__in', 'post_parent__in', and the array keys of $meta_query. Default is 'date', except when a search is being performed, when the default is 'relevance'.
Sort retrieved posts.
Sorts a list of objects, based on one or more orderby arguments.
Sorts the list, based on one or more orderby arguments.
Sorts themes by name.

Stores a log entry.
Stores the given error so that the extension causing it is paused.
Stores the original locale as well as a list of all available languages.
Streams current image to browser.
Streams image in WP_Image_Editor to browser.
Streams image in post to browser, along with enqueued changes in $_REQUEST[‘history’]
String containing the hook name used to determine the current screen. If left null, the current screen will be automatically set. Default null.

Support for posts was added.
Supports basic input types text, checkbox, textarea, radio, select and dropdown-pages. Additional input types such as email, url, number, hidden and date are supported implicitly.
Supports the RFC 1951 standard.

Tag id or comma-separated list of IDs.

Taxonomy being queried. Optional when field=term_taxonomy_id.

Term ID to retrieve child terms of. If multiple taxonomies are passed, $child_of is ignored. Default 0.
Term ID.

Term fields to query for. Accepts 'all' (returns an array of complete term objects), 'all_with_object_id' (returns an array of term objects with the 'object_id' param; works only when the $object_ids parameter is populated), 'ids' (returns an array of ids), 'tt_ids' (returns an array of term taxonomy ids), 'id=>parent' (returns an associative array with ids as keys, parent term IDs as values), 'names' (returns an array of term names), 'count' (returns the number of matching terms), 'id=>name' (returns an associative array with ids as keys, term names as values), or 'id=>slug' (returns an associative array with ids as keys, term slugs as values). Default 'all'.

Test if debug information is enabled.

Test if plugins are outdated, or unnecessary.

Test if the REST API is accessible.

Text domain.
Text of the Reply link. Default is 'Leave a Comment'.

Text or HTML to add before the reply link.

The $args array parameter was added in place of an $echo boolean flag.
The $args parameter holds additional values that may be used with the child class methods.
The $args parameter holds additional values that may be used with the child class methods. Includes the element output also.
The $args parameter holds additional values that may be used with the child class methods. This method finishes the list at the end of output of the elements.
The $args parameter holds additional values that may be used with the child class methods. This method is called at the start of the output list.
The $bookmarks array must contain bookmark objects and will be iterated over to retrieve the bookmark to be used in the output.
The $callback argument should be the name of a function that echoes out any content you want to show at the top of the settings section before the actual fields. It can output nothing if you want.
The $callback argument should be the name of a function that echoes out the html input tags for this setting field. Use get_option() to retrieve existing values to show.

The $content is run through esc_textarea(), which uses htmlspecialchars() to convert special characters to HTML entities. If $richedit is set to true, it is simply a holder for the ‘format_to_edit’ filter.
The $content_struct parameter only needs to contain fields that should be changed. All other fields will retain their existing values.
The $expire parameter is not used, because the cache will automatically expire for each time a page is accessed and PHP finishes. The method is more for cache plugins which use files.
The $inclusive logic was updated to include all times within the date range.
The $meridiem parameter is expected to not be translated.
The $month_name parameter is expected to be the translated or translatable version of the month.
The $month_number parameter has to be a string because it must have the ‘0’ in front of any number that is less than 10. Starts from ’01’ and ends at ’12’.
The $post parameter is now optional.
The $post properties used and must exist are ‘ID’ and ‘post_date_gmt’.

The $query parameter is optional. If it is omitted you must ensure that you call this on, or before, the ‘init’ hook. This is because $query defaults to "$tag=", and for this to work a new query var has to be added.

The $size parameter can be an array with the width and height respectively. If the size matches the ‘sizes’ metadata array for width and height, then it will be used. If there is no direct match, then the nearest image size larger than the specified size will be used. If nothing is found, then the function will break out and return false.
The $terms aren’t checked the same as $taxonomies, but still need to exist for $object_ids to be returned.
The ‘all’ hook passes all of the arguments or parameters that were used for the hook, which this function was called for.
The ‘content_struct’ argument must contain:
The ‘html’ format, which is the default, uses the li HTML element for use in the list HTML elements. The before parameter is before the link and the after parameter is after the closing link.
The ‘link’ format uses the <link> HTML element with the archives relationship. The before and after parameters are not used. The text parameter is used to describe the link.

The ‘mysql’ type will return the time in the format for MySQL DATETIME field. The ‘timestamp’ type will return the current timestamp. Other strings will be interpreted as PHP date formats (e.g. ‘Y-m-d’).
The ‘option’ format uses the option HTML element for use in select element. The value is the url parameter and the before and after parameters are used between the text description.

The ‘post_parent’ argument is the ID to get the children. The ‘numberposts’ is the amount of posts to retrieve that has a default of ‘-1’, which is used to get all of the posts. Giving a number higher than 0 will only retrieve that amount of posts.

The ‘post_parent’ is the most important argument and important attention needs to be paid to the $args parameter. If you pass either an object or an integer (number), then just the ‘post_parent’ is grabbed and everything else is lost. If you don’t specify any arguments, then it is assumed that you are in The Loop and the post parent will be grabbed for from the current post.

The ‘post_tag’ taxonomy is a special case; the class has the ‘tag-‘ prefix instead of ‘post_tag-‘. All class names are passed through the filter, ‘post_class’, with the list of class names, followed by $class parameter value, with the post ID as the last parameter.

The ‘post_type’ and ‘post_status’ arguments can be used to choose what criteria of posts to retrieve. The ‘post_type’ can be anything, but WordPress post types are ‘post’, ‘pages’, and ‘attachments’. The ‘post_status’ argument will accept any post status within the write administration panels.
The ‘type’ DATE works with the ‘compare’ value BETWEEN only if the date is stored at the format YYYY-MM-DD and tested with this format.
The ‘use_verbose_page_rules’ object property will be set to true if the permalink structure begins with one of the following: ‘%postname%’, ‘%category%’, ‘%tag%’, or ‘%author%’.
The 'author', 'email', and 'url' form fields are limited to 245, 100, and 200 characters, respectively.
The do_shortcode() callback function.
The 'nav_menu_item_args' filter was added.
The ‘query_string’ filter is deprecated, but still works. Plugins should use the ‘request’ filter instead.

The ‘get_image_tag_class’ filter allows for changing the class name for the image without having to use regular expressions on the HTML content. The parameters are: what WordPress will use for the class, the Attachment ID, image align value, and the size the image should be.

The ‘get_terms’ filter will be called when the cache has the term and will pass the found term along with the array of $taxonomies and array of $args. This filter is also called before the array of terms is passed and will pass the array of terms, along with the $taxonomies and $args.
The ‘get_terms_orderby’ filter passes the ORDER BY clause for the query along with the $args array.
The ‘list_terms_exclusions’ filter passes the compiled exclusions along with the $args.
The do_shortcode() callback function.
The network administration menu
The $args parameter gives you control over how WP_Rewrite::generate_rewrite_rules() works on the new permastruct.
The $args parameter was added, making clearing the plugin update cache optional.
The $args parameter was added, making clearing the update cache optional.
The $category parameter now also accepts a WP_Term object.
The $class argument was added.
The $context parameter default changed from false to an empty string.
The $default argument was introduced.
The $domain parameter was made optional.

The $file path is passed through a filter hook called ‘comments_template’, which includes the TEMPLATEPATH and $file combined. Tries the $filtered path first and if it fails it will require the default comment template from the default theme. If either does not exist, then the WordPress process will be halted. It is advised for that reason, that the default theme is not deleted.
The $network_id parameter is now being used.
The $object_subtype parameter was added.
The $options parameter takes an associative array with the following options:
The $post parameter was made optional.
The $post_type argument was added.
The $priority argument was added.

The $requests parameter takes an associative or indexed array of request fields. The key of each request can be used to match up the request with the returned data, or with the request passed into your multiple.request.complete callback.
The $richedit parameter was renamed to $rich_text for clarity.
The $role parameter was deprecated.
The $screen parameter now accepts an array of screen IDs.
The $site_id argument was added.
The $site_id parameter was added to support multisite.

The $size parameter accepts either an array or a string. The supported string values are ‘thumb’ or ‘thumbnail’ for the given thumbnail size or defaults at 128 width and 96 height in pixels. Also supported for the string value is ‘medium’, ‘medium_large’ and ‘full’. The ‘full’ isn’t actually supported, but any value other than the supported will result in the content_width size or 500 if that is not set.
The $style parameter was deprecated.
The $taxonomy argument was made optional.
The $taxonomy parameter was made optional. $term can also now accept a WP_Term object.
The $theme argument was added.
The $visited parameter was deprecated and renamed to $deprecated.
The 'date_query' clauses can be nested, in order to construct complex queries. See Taxonomy Parameters for details on the syntax.
The 'meta_query' clauses can be nested in order to construct complex queries. For example, show productss where color=orange OR color=red&size=small translates to the following:
The 'tax_query' clauses can be nested, to create more complex queries. Example: Display posts that are in the quotes category OR both have the quote post format AND are in the wisdom category:
The caption_id attribute was added.
The class attribute was added.
The customize-selective-refresh-widgets feature was added
The html5 feature now also accepts 'gallery' and 'caption'
The html5 feature was added

The responsive-embeds, align-wide, dark-editor-style, disable-custom-colors, disable-custom-font-sizes, editor-color-pallete, editor-font-sizes, editor-styles, and wp-block-styles features were added.
The starter-content feature was added
The tag_slug__in and tag_slug__and behave much the same, except match against the tag’s slug.
The title-tag feature was added
The Google Video embed handler callback.
The HTML markup retrieved will be created for the progress of SWF Upload component. Will also create link for showing and hiding the form to modify the image attachment.
The HTML or text to append to each bookmark inside the anchor tags.
The HTML or text to append to each bookmark. Default </li>.
The HTML or text to prepend to each bookmark inside the anchor tags.
The HTML or text to prepend to each bookmark. Default <li>.
The ID for the setting that this partial is primarily responsible for rendering. If not supplied, it will default to the ID of the first setting.
The Object Cache can be replaced by other caching mechanisms by placing files in the wp-content folder which is looked at in wp-settings. If that file exists, then this file will not be included.

The PNG transparency will be preserved using the function, as well as the image type. If the file going in is PNG, then the resized image is going to be PNG. The only supported image types are PNG, GIF, and JPEG.
The Quick Draft widget display and creation of drafts.
The RSS dashboard widget control.

The Rewrite along with WP class function as a front controller for WordPress. You can add rules to trigger your page view and processing using this component. The full functionality of a front controller does not exist, meaning you can’t define how the template files load based on the rewrite rules.
The URL might be the original image, or it might be a resized version. This function won’t create a new resized copy, it will just return an already resized one if it exists.
The WordPress DB error sets the HTTP status header to 500 to try to prevent search engines from caching the message. Custom DB messages should do the same.

The WordPress Object Cache is used to save on trips to the database. The Object Cache stores all of the cache data to memory and makes the cache contents available by using a key, which is used to name and later retrieve the cache contents.
The WordPress Query class.
The WordPress Rewrite class writes the rewrite module rules to the .htaccess file. It also handles parsing the request to get the correct setup for the WordPress Query class.
The absolute path to the directory of the theme root.
The action ‘wp’ has one parameter that references the WP object. It allows for accessing the properties and methods to further manipulate the object.
The actual HTML output might resemble something like this (the About the Tests page from the Theme Unit Test):
The allowed keys in the content_struct array are:
The amount of comments in a post or total comments.

The arguments listed as defaults are for this function and also of the get_posts() function. The arguments are combined with the get_children defaults and are then passed to the get_posts() function, which accepts additional arguments. You can replace the defaults in this function, listed below and the additional arguments listed in the get_posts() function.
The attachments are for those that have pages as parents and will be retrieved.

The browser’s request for events is proxied with this method, rather than having the browser make the request directly to api.wordpress.org, because it allows results to be cached server-side and shared with other users and sites in the network. This makes the process more efficient, since increasing the number of visits that get cached data means users don’t have to wait as often; if the user’s browser made the request directly, it would also need to make a second request to WP in order to pass the data for caching. Having WP make the request also introduces the opportunity to anonymize the IP before sending it to w.org, which mitigates possible privacy concerns.

The cache contents are grouped by the $group parameter followed by the $key. This allows for duplicate ids in unique groups. Therefore, naming of the group should be used with care and should follow normal function naming guidelines outside of core WordPress usage.
The calendar is cached, which will be retrieved, if it exists. If there are no posts for the month, then it will not be displayed.

The callback functions attached to filter hook $tag are invoked by calling this function. This function can be used to create a new filter hook by simply calling this function with the name of the new hook specified using the $tag parameter.
The calling API should immediately die() after calling this function.
The capabilities are defined in the following format array( 'read' => true ); To explicitly deny a role a capability you set the value for that capability to false.

The capabilities is passed through the ‘role_has_cap’ filter. The first parameter for the hook is the list of capabilities the class has assigned. The second parameter is the capability name to look for. The third and final parameter for the hook is the role name.

The capability_type argument can optionally be registered as an array, with the first value being singular and the second plural, e.g. array(‘story, ‘stories’) Otherwise, an ‘s’ will be added to the value for the plural form. After registration, capability_type will always be a string of the singular value.
The caption text.
The category will converted to maintain backward compatibility.
The child class should call this constructor from its own constructor to override the default $args.

The class names are many. If the post is a sticky, then the ‘sticky’ class name. The class ‘hentry’ is always added to each post. If the post has a post thumbnail, ‘has-post-thumbnail’ is added as a class. For each taxonomy that the post belongs to, a class will be added of the format ‘{$taxonomy}-{$slug}’ – eg ‘category-foo’ or ‘my_custom_taxonomy-bar’.
The comment form element action attribute. Default '/wp-comments-post.php'.
The comment form element class attribute. Default 'comment-form'.
The comment form element id attribute. Default 'commentform'.
The comment form format. Default 'xhtml'. Accepts 'xhtml', 'html5'.
The comment list can be for the blog as a whole or for an individual post.
The comment submit element class attribute. Default 'submit'.
The comment submit element id attribute. Default 'submit'.
The comment submit element name attribute. Default 'submit'.
The comment textarea field HTML.
The compressed TinyMCE file cannot deal with custom themes, so this makes sure that we use the uncompressed TinyMCE file if a theme is defined. Even if we are on a production environment.
The constants are as follows:
The container div will always be returned in the Customizer preview.

The contents of the document are passed in chunks, so we append to the $body property for temporary storage. Returning a length shorter than the length of $data passed in will cause cURL to abort the request with CURLE_WRITE_ERROR.
The contents of the widget form itself.
The contents will be first attempted to be retrieved by searching by the key in the cache group. If the cache is hit (success) then the contents are returned.
The context values are based off of the taxonomy filter functions and supported values are found within those functions.
The cookie is a base64 encoded string with the following format:
The cookie should be validated before calling this API.
The count is cached and updated twice daily. This is not a live count.
The current behavior is to trigger a user error if WP_DEBUG is true.
The current behavior is to trigger a user error if WP_DEBUG is true.
The custom background class.

The custom format uses the before parameter before the link (‘a’ HTML element) and the after parameter after the closing link tag. If the above three values for the format are not used, then custom format is assumed.
The custom header image class.
The database character collate.
The database name will be changed based on the current database connection. On failure, the execution will bail and display an DB error.
The date the last comment was modified.
The deactivation hook is disabled by the plugin upgrader by using the $silent parameter.
The decoded form of category-{slug}.php was added to the top of the template hierarchy when the category slug contains multibyte characters.
The decoded form of page-{page_name}.php was added to the top of the template hierarchy when the page name contains multibyte characters.
The decoded form of tag-{slug}.php was added to the top of the template hierarchy when the tag slug contains multibyte characters.
The decoded form of taxonomy-{taxonomy_slug}-{term_slug}.php was added to the top of the template hierarchy when the term slug contains multibyte characters.
The default $field is ‘id’, therefore it is possible to also use null for field, but not recommended that you do so.
The default directory is WP_LANG_DIR.
The default feed is ‘rss2’, unless a plugin changes it through the ‘default_feed’ filter.
The defaults are as follows:
The depth of the new comment. Must be greater than 0 and less than the value of the 'thread_comments_depth' option set in Settings > Discussion. Default 0.

The difference between this method and WP_Rewrite::rewrite_rules() is that this method stores the rewrite rules in the ‘rewrite_rules’ option and retrieves it. This prevents having to process all of the permalinks to get the rewrite rules in the form of caching.
The difference is returned in a human readable format such as "1 hour", "5 mins", "2 days".
The directory name of the theme’s “stylesheet” files, inside the theme root.
The directory name of the theme’s “template” files, inside the theme root.
The do-it-all function that takes a URL and attempts to return the HTML.
The echo content should be with usage of the permalinks or for creating the robots.txt file.

The endpoint mask defining which endpoints are added to the structure. Accepts EP_NONE, EP_PERMALINK, EP_ATTACHMENT, EP_DATE, EP_YEAR, EP_MONTH, EP_DAY, EP_ROOT, EP_COMMENTS, EP_SEARCH, EP_CATEGORIES, EP_TAGS, EP_AUTHORS, EP_PAGES, EP_ALL_ARCHIVES, and EP_ALL. Default EP_NONE.
The enveloping technique is used to work around browser/client compatibility issues. Essentially, it converts the full HTTP response to data instead.
The equivalent of get_param(), but returns all parameters for the request. Handles merging all the available values into a single array.
The error code can only contain one error data.
The error message.
The error type.
The execution will be halted as soon as one of the plugins has an error.
The extension slug. This is the plugin or theme's directory.
The extension type. Either 'plugin' or 'theme'.
The field to use when ordering the images. Default 'menu_order ID'. Accepts any valid SQL ORDERBY statement.

The file with the plugin data is the file that will be included and therefore needs to have the main execution for the plugin. This does not mean everything must be contained in the file and it is recommended that the file be split for maintainability. Keep everything in one file for extreme optimization purposes.
The filter ‘format_for_editor’ is applied here. If $text is empty the filter will be applied to an empty string.
The filter bar container is rendered by @see render_template().
The first 8kiB of the file will be pulled in and if the plugin data is not within that first 8kiB, then the plugin author should correct their plugin and move the plugin data headers to the top.

The first part of the selector used to identify the comment to respond below. The resulting value is passed as the first parameter to addComment.moveForm(), concatenated as $add_below-$comment->comment_ID. Default 'comment'.

The first part of the selector used to identify the comment to respond below. The resulting value is passed as the first parameter to addComment.moveForm(), concatenated as $add_below-$comment->comment_ID. Default is 'post'.
The following example shows how a callback function is bound to a filter hook.
The following example shows how to implement the body_class template tag into a theme.
The following parameters are read only, and should only be used in the context of current_theme_supports():
The following placeholders can be used in the query string: %d (integer) %f (float) %s (string)

The following re-formulates the logic from wp_trash_post() as done in wp_publish_post(). The reason for bypassing wp_trash_post() is that it will mutate the the post_content and the post_name when they should be untouched.
The form contains only hidden sync inputs. For the control UI, see WP_Widget_Custom_HTML::render_control_template_scripts().

The format can be one of four styles. The ‘link’ for head element, ‘option’ for use in the select element, ‘html’ for use in list (either ol or ul HTML elements). Custom content is also supported using the before and after parameters.

The format of the string is, with empty matches property value, ‘$NUM’. The ‘NUM’ will be replaced with the value in the $number parameter. With the matches property not empty, the value of the returned string will contain that value of the matches property. The format then will be ‘$MATCHES[NUM]’, with MATCHES as the value in the property and NUM the value of the $number parameter.
The formatted output of a list of bookmarks.
The formatted output of a list of pages.
The four-digit year. Accepts any four-digit year.
The four-digit year. Accepts any four-digit year. Default empty.
The four-digit year. Default empty. Accepts any four-digit year.
The full path or URI of the package to install. Default empty.
The full path to the destination folder. Default empty.
The function current_filter() only returns the most recent filter or action being executed. did_action() returns true once the action is initially processed.
The function allows for additional arguments to be added and passed to hooks.
The function is for contextual reasons and for simplicity of usage.
The function which is hooked in to handle the output of the page must check that the user has the required capability as well.

The function works by getting the single post meta name, named ‘_wp_attached_file’ and returning it. This is a convenience function to prevent looking up the meta name and provide a mechanism for sending the attached filename through a filter.
The get_taxonomy function will first check that the parameter string given is a taxonomy object and if it is, it will return it.
The gettext implementation of select_plural_form.
The given categories are checked against the post’s categories’ term_ids, names and slugs. Categories given as integers will only be checked against the post’s categories’ term_ids.

The given tags are checked against the post’s tags’ term_ids, names and slugs. Tags given as integers will only be checked against the post’s tags’ term_ids. If no tags are given, determines if post has any tags.

The given terms are checked against the post’s terms’ term_ids, names and slugs. Terms given as integers will only be checked against the post’s terms’ term_ids. If no terms are given, determines if post has any terms.
The guid will appear to be a link, but should not be used as an link to the post. The reason you should not use it as a link, is because of moving the blog across domains.
The header is sanitized, but is not translated, and is not marked up for display. To get a theme header for display, use the display() method.
The hierarchy for this template looks like:
The id of the parent term. Default 0.
The instance will be created if it does not exist yet.
The intent of this method is to match a network during bootstrap for a requested site address.
The intent of this method is to match a site object during bootstrap for a requested site address
The jQuery selector to find the container element for the partial, that is, a partial's placement.
The just-in-time addition is for the benefit of the ‘oembed_providers’ filter.
The just-in-time removal is for the benefit of the ‘oembed_providers’ filter.

The layout_columns option controls the max number and default number of columns. This method returns the number of columns within that range selected by the user via Screen Options. If no selection has been made, the default provisioned in layout_columns is returned. If the screen does not support selecting the number of layout columns, 0 is returned.
The length may either be specified as a byte length or a character length.

The length of each returned chunk is as close to the specified length goal as possible, with the caveat that each chunk includes its trailing delimiter. Chunks longer than the goal are guaranteed to not have any inner whitespace.
The line number in which the error occurred.
The list of capabilities, must have the key as the name of the capability and the value a boolean of whether it is granted to the role.
The list of keys returned via this function are dependent on the presence of those keys in the user meta data to be set.

The main WP_Rewrite function for building the rewrite rule list. The contents of the function is a mix of black magic and regular expressions, so best just ignore the contents and move to the parameters.
The main screenshot is called screenshot.png. gif and jpg extensions are also allowed.
The max depth of the comment tree. Default 0.
The menu order of the posts.
The metadata ‘sizes’ is used for compatible sizes that can be used for the parameter $size value.

The metadata of the plugin’s data searches for the following in the plugin’s header. All plugin data must be on its own line. For plugin description, it must not have any newlines or only parts of the description will be displayed and the same goes for the plugin data. The below is formatted for printing.
The method creates the translatable strings for various calendar elements. Which allows for specifying locale specific calendar names and text direction.
The method is now static.
The mime type of the post. Used for 'attachment' post_type.

The most appropriate use for get_posts is to create an array of posts based on a set of parameters. It retrieves a list of recent posts or posts matching this criteria. get_posts can also be used to create Multiple Loops, though a more direct reference to WP_Query using new WP_Query is preferred in this case.
The multi-table delete syntax is used to delete the transient record from table a, and the corresponding transient_timeout record from table b.
The name "post_value" is a carry-over from when the customized state was exclusively sourced from $_POST['customized'].

The name "post_value" is a carry-over from when the customized state was exclusively sourced from $_POST['customized']. Nevertheless, the value returned will come from the current changeset post and from the incoming post data.

The name "unsanitized_post_values" is a carry-over from when the customized state was exclusively sourced from $_POST['customized']. Nevertheless, the value returned will come from the current changeset post and from the incoming post data.
The name is the site’s subdomain or the site’s subdirectory path depending on the network settings.
The name of the file in which the error occurred.
The name of the menu to save.
The names “thumb” & “thumbnail” are just aliases- they are exactly the same.
The negative regex is faster for non-ASCII strings, as it allows the search to finish as soon as it encounters a non-ASCII character.
The normal, or site, administration menu
The number by which to offset the terms query.
The number of active sites on your installation.
The number of active users in your installation.
The number of comments to return per page. Default 'comments_per_page' option.
The number of pages to return. Default 0, or all pages.
The number of pages to skip before returning. Requires $number. Default 0.
The number of posts being displayed.
The number of posts to offset before retrieval.
The number of posts to query for by archive page. Overrides 'posts_per_page' when is_archive(), or is_search() are true.
The number of posts to query for. Use -1 to request all posts.
The number of ratings.
The number of the current page.
The number of users with no role is now included in the none element.
The old private function for setting up user contact methods.

The old way to serialize the callback caused issues and this function is the solution. It works by checking for objects and creating a new property in the class to keep track of the object and new objects of the same class that need to be added.
The option will first check for the per site name and then the per Network name.
The optional $fields parameter specifies what fields will be included in the response array.

The optional $fields parameter specifies what fields will be included in the response array. This should be a list of field names. ‘user_id’ will always be included in the response regardless of the value of $fields.
The optional $filter parameter modifies the query used to retrieve users. Accepted keys are ‘number’ (default: 50), ‘offset’ (default: 0), ‘role’, ‘who’, ‘orderby’, and ‘order’.
The optional $autosave parameter was deprecated and renamed to $deprecated.
The optional $sep parameter was deprecated and renamed to $deprecated.
The order for requests is cURL, and then PHP Streams.
The order of the mime type logic was reversed so the hierarchy is more logical.
The original callback for this meta box.
The output is formatted as HTML with no way to change that format. However, what is between, before, and after can be changed. The link itself will be HTML.
The paged.php template is no longer part of the theme template hierarchy.
The panel this section belongs to (if any).
The parameter $data should be either an associative array containing the indices names below or a header string detailing it.
The parameter $stylesheet is the name of the stylesheet, relative to the theme root. It also accepts an array of stylesheets. It is optional and defaults to ‘editor-style.css’.

The parameter should only be passed a variable and not create the array or object inline to the parameter. The reason for this is that parameter is passed by reference and PHP will fail unless it has the variable.
The parameters must not be considered optional. All of the post meta fields will be retrieved and only the meta field key values returned.

The parameters of get_posts are similar to those of get_pages but are implemented quite differently, and should be used in appropriate scenarios. get_posts uses WP_Query, whereas get_pages queries the database more directly. Each have parameters that reflect this difference in implementation.
The path is relative to the current upload dir.

The permalink structure for the date, if not set already depends on the permalink structure. It can be one of three formats. The first is year, month, day; the second is day, month, year; and the last format is month, day, year. These are matched against the permalink structure for which one is used. If none matches, then the default will be used, which is year, month, day.
The permalink structure is front property, author base, and finally ‘/%author%’. Will set the author_structure property and then return it without attempting to set the value again.
The permalink structure is root property, and ‘%pagename%’. Will set the page_structure property and then return it without attempting to set the value again.

The permalink structure is root property, comment base property, feed base and finally ‘/%feed%’. Will set the comment_feed_structure property and then return it without attempting to set the value again.
The permalink structure is root property, feed base, and finally ‘/%feed%’. Will set the feed_structure property and then return it without attempting to set the value again.
The permalink structure is root property, search base, and finally ‘/%search%’. Will set the search_structure property and then return it without attempting to set the value again.
The plugin file is assumed to have permissions to allow for scripts to read the file. This is not checked however and the file is only opened for reading.

The post IDs will have been sanitized by already by WP_Customize_Nav_Menu_Items::sanitize_nav_menus_created_posts() to remove any post IDs for which the user cannot publish or for which the post is not an auto-draft.
The post meta fields are retrieved from the cache where possible, so the function is optimized to be called more than once.
The post title is fetched and if it is blank then a default string is returned.
The post type to query. Default 'page'.
The previous and next element ID to move the focus to when pressing the Tab key in TinyMCE. Default ':prev,:next'.
The previous response ID. Used as the value for the response type old_id attribute. False hides the attribute. Default false.
The primary setting for the control (if there is one). Default 'default'.
The primary setting for the control (if there is one). Default is 'default'.
The priority of the transports are: Direct, SSH2, FTP PHP Extension, FTP Sockets (Via Sockets class, or fsockopen()). Valid values for these are: ‘direct’, ‘ssh2’, ‘ftpext’ or ‘ftpsockets’.
The process to get the locale should only be done once, but the locale will always be filtered using the ‘locale’ hook.
The provider is added just-in-time when wp_oembed_add_provider() is called before the ‘plugins_loaded’ hook.
The provider is removed just-in-time when wp_oembed_remove_provider() is called before the ‘plugins_loaded’ hook.
The query flags are what page info WordPress was able to figure out.
The query_vars property will be extracted to the GLOBALS. So care should be taken when naming global variables that might interfere with the WordPress environment.
The redirection will only happen when on a protected endpoint.
The regular expression combines the shortcode tags in the regular expression in a regex class.
The regular expression contains 6 different sub matches to help with parsing.
The request fields value is an associative array with the following keys:
The response ID, used as the response type id attribute. Also accepts a WP_Error object if the ID does not exist. Default 0.
The response content/message. Also accepts a WP_Error object if the ID does not exist.
The results are now filterable with the 'get_available_languages' filter.
The results include both meta that is registered specifically for the object’s subtype and meta that is registered for the entire object type.
The return value can be overridden by defining the FS_METHOD constant in wp-config.php, or filtering via ‘filesystem_method’.
The returned array consists of a merge of three sources:

The returned array has ‘main’, ‘extended’, and ‘more_text’ keys. Main has the text before the <!--more-->. The ‘extended’ key has the content after the <!--more--> comment. The ‘more_text’ key has the custom "Read More" text.

The returned array has the file size, the image width, and image height. The ‘image_make_intermediate_size’ filter can be used to hook in and change the values of the returned array. The only parameter is the resized file path.
The role key is set to the current prefix for the $wpdb object with ‘user_roles’ appended. If the $wp_user_roles global is set, then it will be used and the role option will not be updated or used.
The role option is simple, the structure is organized by role name that store the name in value of the ‘name’ key. The capabilities are stored as an array in the value of the ‘capability’ key.

The route map is an associative array with path regexes as the keys. The value is an indexed array with the callback function/method as the first item, and a bitmask of HTTP methods as the second item (see the class constants).
The same as parent_item, but with colon : in the end.
The scope argument can take one of the following:
The search query string is passed through esc_attr() to ensure that it is safe for placing in an html attribute.
The second filter, ‘get_image_tag’, has the HTML content, which can then be further manipulated by a plugin to change all attribute values and even HTML content.
The second format will make the initial sorting order be descending

The second is during The Loop. WP_Query provides numerous functions for common tasks within The Loop. To begin with, have_posts(), which calls $wp_query->have_posts(), is called to see if there are any posts to show. If there are, a while loop is begun, using have_posts() as the condition. This will iterate around as long as there are posts to show. In each iteration, the_post(), which calls $wp_query->the_post() is called, setting up internal variables within $wp_query and the global $post variable (which the Template Tags rely on), as above. These are the functions you should use when writing a theme file that needs a loop.
